77ZmgOfDBZXlagsiSeOfTg.text: Take a mini trip to Paris and stuff your belly with 3 courses of incredibly well executed bistro fare for only $32++?  Cannot be, right?  Oh but actually...CAN...most certainly CAN, at least during lunch hours at Bistro Du Vin, Zion!The first thing that struck us on our first visit was the beautifully delicious bread and butter...nothing zany or cutting edge...just delicious, soft warm french bread paired with sweet creamy butter...dangerously delicious and although we usually get a table for 2, we've still been guilty of asking for more bread...it's that good!The aforementioned 3 course lunch for $32++ is the best reason to go and the best options for each course are...drum roll please...Best Entree: Foie gras ravioli with toasted hazelnut & Port wine sauce (one large round ravioli stuffed with rich foie gras and covered with hazelnut gravy)Best Plat Principal: Duck leg confit with pommery mashed potato (some of the time we pay a little more to substitute the amazing truffle fries [every fry is perfectly crispy] or truffle mashers...the duck is absolutely perfect...fall off the bone fork tender meat with perfectly crispy skin)Best Dessert: Baked apple tart on puff pastry with coffee and cardamom ice cream (warm flaky pastry, soft spiced apples and delicious ice cream...how can you go wrong?)PARTING THOUGHT: In case that wasn't enough value for $32++, you also get coffee or tea for FREE!  And that includes your fancy coffee like your latte and cappucino!  Love it!

b-VSKw8b7ZCmX640tanjoA.text: I I have been to France three times but must start by acknowledging that I am not as well versed in French cuisine. With this said, I truly enjoyed this meal.  Obviously one does not come to an establishment expecting large portions but his made me cherish every biteAs is typical, I was challenged to make my selections because everything looked so good.I started with the roasted eggplant and red pepper soup which was quite good. However, I have a feeling the classic French onion would have been a better selection.For my main course I selected the wagyu tenderloin topped with pan fried foie gras (which melted in my mouth with every bite). My largest disappointment comes in what I did not order. After eating I realized there was one more item in the specials that I'm sure would have been excellent. It is white asparagus season and it is flown in fresh in from France - I love white asparagus!For dessert I chose crème brûlée which was also quite good.  My only critique is that the serving was quite thin.  As a result, the sugar overpowered the very tasty vanilla creme. The same portion size would have been fine had it  been in a smaller but deeper serving cup.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore

xuroHCf392lArJ2H_HfSAQ.text: The set lunches at BDV is seriously good value.  Food is decent, all delicious while nothing exciting.  For set lunch, the portions were not minimised so be prepared for a hearty meal!What I really want to applaud is the service level.  We had a big party of more than 10 adults and kids, it was a chaotic lunch on Sunday. Luckily there weren't many other patrons, and the staff remained calm and composed, never lost their cool with all the usual requests by big groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. Duck rillette
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. French onion soup
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. Scallos

MNWW9Xu5bljVXHXqQ0QyxA.text: Just a wonderful bistro to get your french fix.  Think amongst all the dishes we had it was the heart chocking Foie Gras that stole the show.  It was done just right with a slight crisp on the outside but melts in your mouth like butter.  The dish that did nit quite make the mark was Cassoulet.  Feels like a dish of left over put together as a dish.  We are not a big fan of soufflé as the last memory of it was the smell of raw egg.  They did very on this as it is airy, light and looks absolutely nice paring it with a scoop of ice-cream.  So take away is.....i shall be back. And oh yes..the French host was rather entertaining :).

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. Apple Tart
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. Interior
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. The best!!!

9s3fAax8s7LvZLXOujKiTg.text: The foie gras, beef cheek, and ribeye were delicious! The servers were kind and attentive. We definitely plan to come back!

7srMC5pPSj7K3jmIcWRPzg.text: You have to try the beef cheek. It melts in the mouth!!! Do check out the daily specials as well, they have exotic stuff and worth a try.I just tried the white asparagus from the special menu today. Enjoyed it very much!! It was crispy !!

fG1FyAwQx1herQOiWjJdOA.text: First time here. Le wife suggested this place months ago but never got the chance and fortunately we got a table inside with the air condition.Service was prompt and the owner(French guy) was friendly and funny. Making jokes the way I like it . Food came quick and it was awesome. Everything was done right and as of now I am already looking forward  to my next visit there !

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore

PJr5raMuH1PqJbLJQ3FKQg.text: First time dinner at Bistro Du Vin. Nice pleasant ambience. Very French Bistro. Service was very good but then it was a slow night on Thursday. We ordered foie gras, scallops, escargots and their special gravlax. Outstanding was the gravlax. Unfortunately it's not always available. The escargot was a disappointment with bits of grit. The mains were all very good. Best was the confit of suckling pig belly. Which was crisp and meltingly tender. Again preorder if you want this as this sells out fast. We finished with a brace of desserts, all well done. Overall a very nice dinner. Larger than normal portions, value for money and highly recommended. A great place to bring a first date as the atmosphere is unthreatening and relaxing. Had a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. Chocolate fondant

BuWEx8FHY-Karp4l1drxVw.text: For the price, this French bistro by les Amis is amazingly good value. We were there for dinner.Ambiance is very classic french bistro, which is great. Service was also very good. Our waitress was friendly and not pushy.Wine - they have reasonable wine by carafe. Two thumbs up!Food: Pan fried foie gras is great. Not the best I've tried, but the best were in restaurants that cost many times of here. So I would gladly eat the one here again.Daily special of butter poached pink trout - so so good. the trout is deboned and so succulent and tender. Perfectly cooked and not dry. Add the french beans and toasted almonds, it has a wonderful combination of taste and bite. Love this dish!Daily special of mussels in white wine sauce - the white wine sauce is great, very flavorful and a good amount of wine taste, garlic and many other goodies. However, the mussels were way too tiny! they looked so shrivelled and sad that I think it totally did an injustice to the wonderful broth.Grand Marnier souffle - 20min wait time, but so worth the wait. Exactly how a good souffle should be. Order it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. Grand marnier souffle with vanilla ice cream
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. Truffle fries
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. Mussel in white wine sauce

t7xHeMtiXiGT0ruZdh82LA.text: oh my, can someone say dessert please? this one's a good choice, the first time I've made it to the lauded bistro du vin - and only for dessert (after dinner at indochilli, just a few doors down).they have a proper, legit chocolate fondant full of dark chocolate and not too much sugar, with oozey batter coming out a nice crusty cake. dee-licious.speckly vanilla ice cream on the side too, but you don't expect any less do you?annnnnnd, a slightly eggy creme brulee with a crackly sugar top browned enough for flavor and satisfyingly charred in a couple spots - pretty good, though there's really nothing to beat chocolate.the top pictures were of the mont-blanc - chestnut, vanilla ice cream, rum, meringue, whipped cream, chocolate pearls & chocolate sauce - and a lot less interesting than it sounds. skip this.so yes, desserts pretty good - and I've heard good things about the food. pretty much worth the calories.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. magic fingers!
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. chocolate fondant

gkBMPdiBy-RQDU29RcBpDA.text: Bistro du Vin is one of Les Amis Group's restaurant that serves classic French bistro food. The place is kinda cool/chic with its French feel.We had onion soup for starters and it was good. Nothing extraordinary, but it was up to its standard. The highlight of the meal was the pork chop. Now, pork chop may seem to be a very simple dish, but it is very easy to screw it up. But theirs was perfectly moist and tender, without being too fatty. The caramelized onion & shallot on top was a perfect compliment to the pork.The Grand Marnier souffle was a very good end to the meal. It is everything a souffle should be.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. Pan-roasted pork chop, caramelized shallot, garlic
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. Grand Marnier souffle
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. French onion soup

kvOL2nbqLq1qDCccENxyrA.text: The evening started well with my party of 5 adults and 3 kids placing our orders. The appetizers arrived shortly after. Presentation and the food was very nice. However，that also marked the start of our unpleasantness. Main courses took more than 30 minutes after our appetizers were cleared. Upon query，a waitress replied saying that a kitchen staff had missed our order. It took my inquiry for them to find out what had happened when all other tables had their main courses served and completed. By then the night had dragged on too long for my young children and what was supposed to be a birthday celebration for my brother turned out to be an abrupt end without desserts nor cake.

95N0d5T_G1D8pGHk6GsCIA.text: Bistro du Bin always serves good, solid food for an excellent value. It is a regular date night restaurant for us. If they're having a wine dinner event, do plan to attend. You won't be disappointed, as they are extremely generous with both the wine and food portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Bistro Du Vin - Singapore, Singapore. Amazing wine dinner last night! For $85 per pax we got SO much food and wine. It was basically free-flow. Highly recommended.
